alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 5:23PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Platte County through 600 PM MDT... At 523 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout over Chugcreek, or over Wheatland, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 30 mph, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wheatland, Chugcreek, Lakeview North, Y-O Ranch and Westview Circle. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 75 and 90. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County
